Academic Success

Follow these links to resources for academic success at SDSU:
Student Affairs provides enriching experiences both inside and outside the classroom to help students reach their full potential.

Academic Advisers/Counselors
Academic honesty and tutorials
Academic & major-related student organizations
Academic services for students living on campus:
Residential Education Office
Residential learning communities
STAR Centers (Students Taking Academic Responsibility)

 SDSU's Love Library has more than 7 million items in its collection and over 800 public use computers. Learn more about the library.
Center for Student Rights and ResponsibilitiesCollege Avenue Compact
Commuter student resources
Compact for SuccessDisabilities, students with — Academic services:
   High Tech CenterIndividualized writing assistanceFAST Program:All California resident first-time freshmen admitted to San Diego State 
University who have remediation needs in English or mathematics will be 
required to enroll in a program to become college ready in the summer 
prior to fall enrollment. Participation in a college readiness program 
is mandatory and required system-wide. College readiness programs are 
offered at SDSU from early July to mid-August; students should make 
their summer plans accordingly. 
ELM and EPT (Testing Office)
EOP (Educational Opportunity Programs and Ethnic Affairs) academic services
   Visit EOP Programs and Services to find information about Best Summer Bridge, Center for Academic Assistance and Training, counseling, First Contact EOP Orientation, and SDSU Guardian Scholars/ Foster Youth
Honors societiesLibrary and Information Access
Master of Arts program Postsecondary Educational Leadership with a Specialization in Student Affairs
MentoringMentoring AssessmentMentoring Opportunities and Activities
New student orientation (Orientation focuses on academic planning and prepares you to register for classes): 
   
				Freshman orientation
Transfer student orientation
Privacy of academic records: Under FERPA,
 SDSU is limited in the information that it may share about you. For 
instance, your parents may not view certain records (grades, transcripts, class schedule) unless you share them or grant
 permission in writing for SDSU to share them. Problem resolutionReality ChangersResidential Learning Communities
Scholarships
Study abroadStudy areas on campusLibraryStudent Learning Lounge
Testing Office
Writing Center: A free service for SDSU students and faculty. Make an appointment or drop on for help from a writing tutor.
Writing Placement Assessment (WPA)
Undeclared student resources
 Note that this list is not exhaustive. Academic departments, 
divisions, programs, and other SDSU organizations may provide resources for academic success that are not listed here.
					


The Division of Student Affairs
The mission of Student Affairs is to support the growth and academic success of all students to help them meet their highest educational aspirations. Learn about how Student Affairs supports students’ academic success.

Did You Know?
Participation in New Student Orientation has been shown to boost the academic success of incoming students.  



Living On Campus
Students who live on campus have a 10-15% better chance of doing well in college.  What's it like to live on campus at SDSU? Watch this YouTube video.
